report_title: Local Specialized Freight Trucking in the US
executive_summary: Local specialized freight truckers performed well during the current period, but revenue was volatile. Solid economic conditions increased spending on local specialized freight trucking in the years right before the pandemic, as high wages and consumer spending generated the need for specialized freight trucking from the retail, manufacturing and other relevant sectors. COVID-19 caused consumer spending, industrial production and fuel prices to sink, contributing to a significant drop in revenue in 2020. Recent economic disruptions have created new problems for the industry. The Federal Reserve has been raising interest rates in response to high inflation, inhibiting demand for construction, a sector that often local specialized freight trucking.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Strong Economic Conditions Prior to the Period Spurred Demand for Trucking
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In the late 2010s, the US underwent rapid GDP growth, reaching the peak of a decade-long expansion after the 2008 financial crisis. Strong economic conditions led to record-low unemployment, rapid wage increases and high disposable income per person. These factors encouraged high consumer spending, which boosted demand in the retail, manufacturing and construction sectors.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand Surged as the Economy Opened Up
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As vaccination rates picked up and social distancing rules were relaxed, demand in the retail, construction and manufacturing sectors rose dramatically. Consumers used the piles of cash they received from the federal government during the pandemic, spreading their newfound consumption across several sectors, retail and home improvement being the most notable.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Industry Has Been Facing a Slew of New Challenges
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Inflation began surging in 2021 and continued into 2023, causing the Federal Reserve to increase interest rates to tame prices. The elevated cost of borrowing has made it more expensive for corporations to borrow money for new office space and other nonresidential structures, hindering demand from construction.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Growing Economy Will Boost Downstream Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite current concerns regarding high inflation, rising interest rates and recessionary fears, the economy is expected to perform well during the outlook period. Rising US real GDP will contribute to a steady rise in consumer spending and the industrial production index (IPI), boosting demand for trucking in many sectors, especially retail and manufacturing.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: FALLING INTEREST RATES WILL BENEFIT THE CONSTRUCTION SECTOR
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As interest rates rise, money will be sucked out of the economy and spending by households and businesses will decline, causing inflation to drop to normal levels during the outlook period. Since inflation will be lower, the central bank will reduce interest rates, making it less expensive to borrow money to purchase residential and nonresidential structures.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: DECLINING OIL PRICES WILL INHIBIT SURCHARGES FOR LOCAL SPECIALIZED FREIGHT TRUCKERS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Oil and gas prices will subside during the outlook period as energy production ramps up worldwide and supply chain issues related to the pandemic are resolved. Since these prices were abnormally high recently, they encouraged companies to shut down or stop doing business with truckers, causing revenue to fall. Prices that fall from these historic highs will increase business again, boosting revenue.

industry_definition: Local specialized freight truckers offer specialized road transportation for cargo using trucks and trailers. These companies provide trucking within metropolitan areas that may cross state lines, taking trips that are often same-day returns. Specialized freight transportation is the movement of cargo that requires specialized equipment for transportation because of the shipment's size, weight and shape.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - steady

key_trends: Becoming a local specialized freight trucker requires little capital, so many small companies are prominent in the industry. This makes it difficult for large companies to gain market share, keeping market share concentration low and internal competition relatively high.

The industry has a few substitutes, such as rail transport and in-house producers of its services. Technological advancements and an increased focus on sustainability influence alternative solutions for logistical needs.

Local specialized freight truckers saw a revenue surge because of robust economic growth during the recovery. However, economic uncertainty following the surge has negatively impacted the industry, leading to contracting demand and financial challenges.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Companies in this market pay local specialized freight truckers to transport petroleum and other bulk liquid and gas products.
Manufacturers often hire truckers to move heavy machinery, base metals and components of manufactured goods. Truckers transporting automobiles often send them to shipping docks and wholesalers.
This market includes the transport of foodstuffs such as fruits, vegetables, grains and corn via trucks.
Construction companies often seek local specialized freight truckers to transport byproducts of construction supplies and construction equipment.
Other types of markets include transporting wholesale goods, waste and some types of food and beverages.
Local specialized freight truckers transport various retail products, including electronics, pharmaceuticals and furniture.
Transportation of alcohol and tobacco products.

products_and_services.product_description: The movement of goods such as metals, coal, grains, gravel and sand, which haven't been packaged before being put onto trucks.
Moving hazardous materials such as chemicals, gases and nonhazardous materials such as water.
Transportation of climate-controlled materials like fruits, vegetables, milk.
Transportation of other miscellaneous packed goods.
Non-transportation services like packing, warehousing, handling and towing.

tier_1_suppliers: Freight Forwarding Brokerages & Agencies in the US
Ocean & Coastal Transportation in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The industrial production index (IPI) measures the output of many of the industry's downstream markets, such as the mining, manufacturing and gas production sectors.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region contains large states with high population, causing many manufacturers, construction companies and retailers to relocate there and satisfy local demand.
The Great Lakes region is known for its prevalence in the manufacturing sector and is home to major automakers.
The Plains region is the center of American agriculture, producing many of the nation's crops which require transportation.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Hazardous Materials Transportation Authorization Act of 1994
regulations_points.regulation_description: This law imposes strict rules on the movement of hazardous materials.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The FDA Food Safety Modernization Act (FSMA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: This law ensures food safety during transportation.
Truckers must comply with state-level health laws for transporting hazardous materials.
These laws require trucking companies to use environmentally friendly fuel.
The FMCSA regulates and provides safety oversight for commercial motor vehicles.
These rules limit driving hours to ensure driver safety.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Becoming a local specialized freight trucker requires little capital.
Entering companies often face no specific licensing constraints.
Business owners must adhere to trucking safety regulations.

basis_points.basis_description: Most local specialized freight truckers focus on transporting specific types of goods.
Hiring skilled labor is essential for operational efficiency.

concentration_points.concentration_description: There are few major licensing laws or capital requirements.
Most truckers only operate in one market.

top_companies.company_name: Hunt J B Transport Services Inc.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Companies need to replace and improve trucks, software, and communication systems.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: INFLATION PUTS UPWARD PRESSURE ON PURCHASE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Massive government spending and supply disruptions have caused costs to skyrocket.
Wages are significantly affected by rising costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: HIGH FUEL PRICES RAISE PROFIT FOR LOCAL SPECIALIZED FREIGHT TRUCKERS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Rising gas prices have created challenges but can also benefit profits.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Skilled labor is essential for business success.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Fluctuations in energy prices can impact profitability.
High borrowing costs can dampen demand.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Changes in Economic Conditions Affect the Industry's Performance
volatility_points.volatility_description: Demand can fluctuate significantly based on economic conditions.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Safer Dry Bulk Transportation Reduces Risks for Local Specialized Freight Truckers
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: - New filtration systems improve air quality in containers.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Introduction of Flexitanks Make Transporting Liquid Cheaper
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Flexitanks are more cost-effective for transporting liquids.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by imports/exports from/to abroad?
FAQs.answer: A strong portion of the US Transportation industries are generated by handling and transportation of imports and exports from air and shipping ports.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of consumer spending?
FAQs.answer: Revenue in the industry is heavily generated by retailers looking to satisfy consumer demand.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile diesel costs over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Diesel prices fluctuate wildly and create significant revenue uncertainty.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing fuel regulations?
FAQs.answer: Fuel efficiency is becoming increasingly important to the industry.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Driver wages are rising due to the ongoing staffing shortage.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology, such as ELDs, in its operations?
FAQs.answer: The new ELD systems are supposed to greatly improve fuel efficiency and driver safety.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Driver safety is a key issue in the industry.
